attributes.background: Driving too closely to other vehicles or attempting to bully drivers

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

Tailgating is already illegal, as it is considered careless driving. Those found guilty face a fixed penalty of £100 and 3 points on their driver’s licence. The most serious examples will continue to go through court, where offenders may face higher penalties. You can find out more here:

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/new-penalties-to-tackle-tailgating-and-middle-lane-hogging

We are therefore not sure what else you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
